title: King Alexander's Cup
text:
The King Alexander's Cup () or Friendship Cup was an international <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition contested by the national teams of <a href="Romania%20national%20football%20team">Romania</a> and <a href="Yugoslavia%20national%20football%20team">Yugoslavia</a>. 
The tournament was named after <a href="Alexander%20I%20of%20Yugoslavia">Alexander I</a>, the <a href="King%20of%20Yugoslavia">King of Yugoslavia</a> and was organized to celebrate the wedding of <a href="Alexander%20I%20of%20Yugoslavia">King Alexander I of Yugoslavia</a> with the <a href="Maria%20of%20Yugoslavia">Princess Maria of Romania</a>. The 1936, 1937 and 1939 editions were called King Carol's Cup, after <a href="Carol%20II%20of%20Romania">Carol II of Romania</a> and the last edition was called King Mihai Cup named after <a href="Michael%20I%20of%20Romania">Mihai of Romania</a>.
